AI Description: GNU Parallel is a command-line tool for executing jobs in parallel, allowing for efficient utilization of multiple CPU cores. It provides a simple syntax to parallelize the execution of shell commands or scripts across multiple processors, improving overall performance and reducing processing time.
Core Features: Execute Jobs In Parallel, Utilize Multiple Cpu Cores Efficiently, Easy-To-Use Syntax For Parallelizing Shell Commands, Supports Parallel Execution On Multiple Machines, Can Be Used For Both Single-Core & Multi-Core Systems
General Tags: Job Scheduling, Parallel Computing, Command-Line Tool, Job Execution
